prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what draws you to these specific spaces?
I tend to be interested in communities that include people from many different areas of the world, to see what life is like in other places.
What types of articles or blogs do you usually read online, and what makes these topics particularly engaging for you?

Aside from general news stories and national politics, I like to read about interesting mysteries or crimes. I find them engaging because I'm interested in what compels people to commit unusual and heinous acts.
Can you share some of your favorite hobbies or activities that you enjoy in your free time, and how do these interests influence the type of content you seek out online?

I like to cook, go hiking, and spend time with my family, though I'm not sure these interests have too much influence on the type of content I seek out online. I do like to look up recipes, but I don't really engage in any online cooking communities.
What types of documentaries, movies, or TV shows do you enjoy watching, and how do these preferences reflect your interests in certain topics or themes?

I like documentaries on a number of topics, such as nature, science, etc. As for movies and TV shows, I tend to like fun action movies, or occasionally comedies. I also enjoy mysteries and dramas, and also sci-fi. I suppose these preferences do reflect my interests in news topics, though not directly.
What types of books or literature do you enjoy reading, and how do these choices influence your perspective on the world or the types of online articles you seek out?

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I would be interested in how the adoption of electric cars in Norway differs from the situation in the US.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I wouldn't be too interested in the details of the Royal Family's coronations.

Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?

evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: AI is definitely a topic I find interesting in general.

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
